vague_description: The sandwich company needs to determine the optimal number of dine-in places and food-trucks to open such that they meet their daily sandwich production requirements while staying within their available workforce limit.
detailed_description: A sandwich company can open two types of stores, a dine-in place and a food-truck. A dine-in place can make \var{DineInProd} sandwiches per day and requires \var{DineInEmp} employees to operate. A food-truck can make \var{FoodTruckProd} sandwiches per day and requires \var{FoodTruckEmp} employees to operate. The company must make at least \var{MinSandProd} sandwiches per day but they only have available \var{TotalEmp} employees. How many of each type of store should the company open to minimize the total number of stores?
target_objective: Minimize the total number of dine-in places and food-trucks
target_constraints: Number of dine-in places is an integer
Number of food-trucks is an integer
Number of dine-in places is non-negative
Dine-in places and food-trucks collectively make at least MinSandProd sandwiches per day
Total number of employees used by dine-in places and food-trucks does not exceed TotalEmp
target_parameters: Sandwich production per day by a dine-in place
Employees needed to operate a dine-in place
Sandwich production per day by a food-truck
Employees needed to operate a food-truck
Minimum number of sandwiches to be made per day
